Title: Data Science Lead
JD:
About the job
    


Johnson and Johnson is recruiting for a Data Science Lead. This position is located in Raritan, NJ. Candidates will be considered in North America and Brazil. This position may require up to 25% travel (domestic and international). 
Remote work options may be considered on a case-by-case basis and if approved by the Company.
Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products, and services to advance the health and well-being of people. At Johnson & Johnson, we believe good health is the foundation of vibrant lives, thriving communities and forward progress. That’s why for more than 130 years, we have aimed to keep people well at every age and every stage of life. 
Today, as the world’s largest and most broadly-based healthcare company, we are committed to using our reach and size for good. We strive to improve access and affordability, create healthier communities, and put a healthy mind, body and environment within reach of everyone, everywhere. Every day, our more than 130,000 employees across the world are blending heart, science and ingenuity to profoundly change the trajectory of health for humanity. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to equity. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
We are embarking on a major strategic transformation of our Cyber Security Data Science, Analytics, and Intelligent Automation over the next 3 years. This is an exciting opportunity to be a member of our J&J Information Security and Risk Management (ISRM) organization who will work at the intersection of business strategy, human-centered design, and emerging technology platform/program delivery.
The Data Science lead will engineer/develop intelligent data products to accurately detect, protect, and report key cyber vulnerabilities, threats, or events.Specific responsibilities:Develop and engineer algorithms and end-to-end intelligent data products to detect existing/emerging cyber threats along with actionable insights and measurable business impacts.Develop scalable and efficient automated processes for data products’ validation, implementation, and monitoring. Identify and analyze the applicability and scalability of innovative data technologies, algorithms, and tools for threat intelligence Develop custom cyber threat detection rule sets and other content for a variety of security platforms, including SIEMs and SOAR. Proactively engage with her/his internal key cyber security partners to align with their strategic, tactical and analytical needsDevelop & monitor solid project case, plans, business partner engagements, implementation timelines, training and deployment schedules relating to her/his products.Define & prioritize her/his products key capabilities backlog and handle related customer expectations / timelines.Delivers quality work and outstanding customer service in a high-pressure, fast paced setting to meet company needs.Ensure full compliance with external and internal data privacy, system documentations, data life cycle and security guidelines.Responsible for key vendor & customer relationships across the platforms and services. Set up and monitor clear product SLA, measurable performance, product health monitoring and continuous improvement. Qualifications4-6 years of practical experience with Data Science and end to end data product development.A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering majors, or equivalent years of experience in a comparable role with a demonstrable track record of successful experiences is requiredDemonstrated experience in all phases of managing data projects including problem definition, solution formulation, model building, productionizing, and delivering measurable impact.Proven experience with scripting languages for data processing and AI/ML model development (Including but not limited to SQL, Spark, Python, and R)Knowledge of traditional ML concepts such as SVMs, trees, and boosting as well as more recent deep learning fundamentals.Experience in cloud-based data engineering solutions like Azure, AWS, Google, advanced SQL query development & database modelling. Experience in leading data projects end-to-end, influencing others without having supervisory responsibility is required. Excellent hands-on, multi-functional skills in multiple technology areas such as servers, network, data center and applications are required.· Strong communicator with excellent verbal and written presentation skills - able to evangelize data informed decision-making at all levels.Ability to work independently, in fast paced environment and prioritize in parallel while managing expectations. Must have a strong customer service orientation, eye for business value, and a bias for action.
Preferred · Experience with developing intelligent data products for Cyber Security, Threat Intelligence, and Fraud Monitoring applications.Cyber certification: CISSP or CISM with deep expertise of network / server / db / app / user security, configuration and cyber related data points.Familiarity with the MITRE ATT&CK model and associated TTP is preferredAn Advanced degree is preferred.
At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, depending on location and subject to local legislation, candidates offered employment may be required to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or, in certain countries, secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work. If you are invited to interview for the position, your recruiter will advise on the vaccine requirement status in your geographic location.
Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.]

About the job
    


Johnson & Johnson
Title: Senior Data Analyst (Analyst 3 - Database Management)
Location: Irvine, CA/ 2 days in office 3 days remote, 8-5pm
Duration:  6 Month Contract
Benefits on offer for this contract position: Health Insurance, Life insurance, 401K and Voluntary Benefits
 Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Johnson & Johnson through external staffing partners of Kelly OCG. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by a contract staffing supplier and will not be an employee of Johnson & Johnson. 
Summary:
Sr. Analyst – Call center analytics supporting US call center operations.
 Responsibilities:
 Supporting US call center operations SME support for analysis, audit, and reporting. Directly support audit reporting, ACD reporting, KPI/operational reporting
Qualifications:
 Strong Microsoft Excel, MS Access, and Tableau skills Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Must be able to manage multiple priorities and delivery on tight deadlines/timelines Ability to solve problems and exercise independent judgment Effective communication skills are required.
